Energy-Aware Millimeter-Wave Radar Eye Movement Monitoring Design

May 15, 2025

ES-Eyes is a non-contact eye-movement monitoring system using energy-aware and micro-Doppler fusion algorithms with millimeter-wave radar. It first locates the face via a reflection-intensity model and energy variance, then removes interference using a head-motion model combined with time–frequency analysis, and finally accurately detects blinks and eye closures by exploiting micro-Doppler and energy differences. Tests show an average recognition accuracy of 93.2%, a blink-rate error of only 0.0487 blinks/sec, and an eye-closure duration error ≤ 0.12 sec. The system features low power consumption, occlusion resistance, and privacy protection. In this project, I contributed to designing the reflection-intensity and micro-Doppler–energy discrimination algorithms and handled experimental planning and millimeter-wave radar data collection.
